definitions.definition: A type of sauce made from milk and eggs (and usually sugar, and sometimes vanilla or other flavourings) and thickened by heat, served hot poured over desserts , as a filling for some pies and cakes, or cold and solidified; also used as a base for some savoury dishes, such as quiches , or eaten as a stand-alone dessert ; egg custard .
A similar sauce made from milk and cornflour or custard powder (and usually sugar, and sometimes vanilla or other flavourings) and thickened by heat.

main_definition: A type of sauce made from milk and eggs (and usually sugar, and sometimes vanilla or other flavourings) and thickened by heat, served hot poured over desserts , as a filling for some pies and cakes, or cold and solidified; also used as a base for some savoury dishes, such as quiches , or eaten as a stand-alone dessert ; egg custard .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) A similar sauce made from milk and cornflour or custard powder (and usually sugar, and sometimes vanilla or other flavourings) and thickened by heat.
